thread.title: Morocco changes the balance of power against Spain
thread.title_full: Morocco changes the balance of power against Spain

author: athena.
title: Morocco changes the balance of power against Spain
text: Morocco purchased, at the end of last year for an amount of around one billion dollars, this Israeli satellite dedicated to intelligence missions, replacing the Mohammed VI-A and Mohammed VI-B satellites. The Ofek 13 satellite, the most advanced in its class, “will enable the collection of information in all weather and visibility conditions, thereby improving strategic intelligence,” said Boaz Levy, CEO of Israeli company IAI. Read: Spy satellite: Morocco chooses Israel and snubs [France](/tag/France) The acquisition of this system by Morocco, which has strengthened and modernized its army over the last ten years, will undoubtedly change the balance of power in the Strait of Gibraltar in its favor, analysis La Razon. According to the 2023 report on national security in Spain, no cases of espionage on the part of Moroccan intelligence services were recorded during the period, unlike Russia and China, notes the Spanish media, however mentioning his fears, in view of the Pegasus affair. Read: Morocco acquires new spyware similar to Pegasus (QuaDream) In this case, Morocco was suspected of having used Israeli spy software Pegasus to hack the cell phones of Pedro Sanchez and the Ministers of Defense and Interior, Margarita Robles and Fernando Grande-Marlaska. A judicial investigation was opened, but no evidence to support Morocco’s involvement in this matter was established. Likewise, the kingdom is suspected of being behind cyberattacks that occurred in Spain in 2011, 2014 and 2019. These suspicions have not been confirmed.
